superseding_details.unit_reference: ALTERATIONS TO EXISTING PROPERTY AND NEW DWELLING

description: Erection of a two storey house with basement and light wells adjoining 93 and the erection of a single storey rear infill extension and front extension to 93
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (12202-PA-01, 12202-PA-21, 12202-PA-22, 12202-PA-23, 12202-PA-25, 12202-PA-27, 12202-PA-30, Engineering Assessment and Subterranean Construction Method Statement received 3 November 2022; 12202-PA-24A, 12202-PA-26A, 12202-PA-28A, 12202-PA-29A, 12202-PA-31A, Building Regulations England Part L (BREL) Compliance Report, Energy Statement, GLA Carbon Reporting Spreadsheet received 7 December 2022) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.

Condition : 3 - No demolition or construction work shall take place on the site except between the hours of 8:00am  to 6:00pm on Mondays to Friday and 9 :00am to 1:00pm on Saturdays and none shall take place on Sundays and Public Holidays without the prior agreement of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - No development shall be carried out until such time as the person carrying out the work is a member of the Considerate Constructors Scheme and its code of practice, and the details of the membership and contact details are clearly displayed on the site so that they can be easily read by members of the public.
Condition : 5 - The hereby approved Construction Method Statement shall be adhered to throughout the construction period for the development.

Condition : 6 - The house hereby approved shall be used solely as a single family house (Use Class C3) and shall not be used for business purposes and or as a house in multiple occupation, including any use within Class C4 of The Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 (as amended) or such other legislation as may subsequently supersede it.
Condition : 7 - The basement hereby permitted shall at no time be used or occupied as a separate dwelling independent of the main house and shall not be used as sleeping accommodation.

Condition : 8 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development Order) 1995 (or any order revoking or re-enacting that order), no enlargement of the premises or any additional structures/buildings/enclosures within the curtilage of the site shall be carried out. Furthermore, no additional floor space shall be formed within the building(s) hereby permitted by means of internal horizontal division (new mezzanine level) without prior written approval of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 9 - The front, side and rear garden shall be divided as shown on the plan drawing numbered 12202-PA-29A and thereafter maintained as such for the duration of the development hereby permitted.
Condition : 10 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the extension to No 93 St Johns Road hereby permitted shall match those used the existing property.

Condition : 13 - (a) The development hereby permitted shall be implemented in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy.
(b) Prior to first occupation of any dwelling within the development hereby approved evidence (e.g. photographs, installation contracts and As-Built certificates under the Standard Assessment Procedure/National Calculation Method) shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to show that the development has been constructed in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy, and any subsequent approved revisions, and achieved a 73 % reduction in emissions.
(c) Upon final commencement of operation of any low and zero carbon technologies, suitable devices for the monitoring of the low and zero carbon technologies shall have been installed, and the monitored data shall be submitted automatically to a monitoring web-platform at daily intervals for a period of three years from the point of full operation.

Condition : 14 - Prior to first occupation of the development the applicant shall have entered into a formal agreement with the Council to provide a payment of ?1,164 towards its Carbon Offset Fund, as outlined in the hereby approved Energy Statement.

Condition : 15 - Prior to first occupation of the building hereby approved, evidence (e.g. photographs and copies of installation contracts) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority to demonstrate that:
(i)	At least three of the key elements of the building envelope (external walls, windows roof, upper floor slabs, internal walls, floor finishes/coverings) are to achieve a rating of A+ to D in the Building Research Establishment (BRE) The Green Guide of specification.
(ii)	At least 50% of timber and timber products are to be sourced from accredited Forest Stewardship Council (FSC) or Programme for the Endorsement of Forestry Certification (PEFC) scheme.
(iii)	No construction or insulation materials are to be used which would release toxins into the internal and external environment, including those that deplete stratospheric ozone.
The development shall be maintained in accordance with the approved details at all times thereafter.

Condition : 16 - Prior to first occupation of the building(s) hereby approved, evidence (schedule of installed fittings and manufactures literature) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority to demonstrate that the development has achieved an internal water use of 105L/person/day or less.

Condition : 17 - Prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved, full details (including manufacturer's specification) of secure covered cycle parking facilities (for not less than two bicycles) for the occupants of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved facilities shall conform to the West London Cycle Parking Guidance (WestTRANS) or any successor guidance in design and layout and be fully implemented and be made available for use before the first occupation of the development and thereafter retained for use at all times without obstruction.

Condition : 18 - Prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved details of the arrangements for storing of waste and recycled materials shall first have been submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The details so approved shall be carried out as approved and shall be completed before the accommodation hereby permitted is first occupied.

Condition : 19 - Prior to first occupation of the hereby approved development, full details of the proposed vehicular crossover should be submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.
The full details should demonstrate that:
-	The maximum width of the double crossover would be no greater 4.2 metres.
-	The parking area would be 4.8 metres deep and 2.4 metres wide for each car.
-	The boundary wall should be no higher than 600mm.
-	Pedestrian visibility splays of 2.4m x 2.4m should be achieved.
-	A 1.2 metre wide clear path to the front door of the property from the street should provided

Condition : 20 - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use, the Local Planning Authority shall be informed of the agreed naming and numbering of the proposed dwelling so that arrangements can be put in place to ensure that, with the exception of a person eligible for a disabled person's badge issued pursuant to section 21 of the Chronically Sick and Disabled Persons Act 1970 (or similar legislation), no resident of the development shall obtain a resident's parking permit. Any occupiers of the approved development shall surrender any such permit wrongly issued or held.
